concise_definition: adj. 受影响的, 装腔作势的; v. 影响, 假装 (过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: Influenced or changed by an external factor, often in a noticeable or significant way; typically used to describe emotional, physical, or environmental impacts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 受到外部因素影响或改变的，通常指情绪、身体或环境方面有明显或显著的变化。
definitions.example_en: The affected communities are still recovering from the flood.
definitions.example_cn: 受灾社区仍在从洪水中恢复。

definitions.explanation_en: Artificially or excessively stylized in behavior or speech, often to impress others; implies pretense or lack of sincerity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 行为或言语上刻意做作、过度修饰，常为博取他人注意，带有虚伪或不真诚的意味。
definitions.example_en: His affected accent made him seem insincere and pretentious.
definitions.example_cn: 他那做作的口音让他显得虚伪而矫揉造作。

definitions.explanation_en: To have an influence on or produce a change in someone or something, often subtly or indirectly.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对某人或某物产生影响或造成某种变化，通常指微妙或间接的作用。
definitions.example_en: The cold weather affected the harvest this year.
definitions.example_cn: 今年的寒冷天气影响了收成。

definitions.explanation_en: To pretend to have or feel something, especially an emotion or quality, often to deceive or impress.
definitions.explanation_cn: 假装拥有或感受某种情感或特质，常为欺骗或博取他人注意。
definitions.example_en: She affected indifference when she really cared deeply.
definitions.example_cn: 她其实非常在意，却假装漠不关心。

comparison.analysis: “Influenced” (受影响) 更中性，强调外部因素对某人或某事的间接作用，不带有情感色彩或主观评价。而 “affected” 在作形容词时，常隐含负面或过度反应的意味，尤其在描述行为时带有‘做作’的贬义。
“Pretended” (假装) 是动词，直接表达‘虚假表现’的行为，语义明确。而 “affected” 作为形容词时，描述的是持续性的、风格化的做作状态，更侧重于性格或表达方式的伪装，而非单一行为。
“Impacted” (强烈影响) 通常指直接、显著、有时是物理性的冲击，常用于科学或正式语境，强调结果的强度。而 “affected” 更广泛，可指轻微、间接或情感上的影响，适用范围更广，但强度较弱。
